Oscar winner Robert De Niro, Paul Dano (There Will Be Blood) and Oscar nominee Julianne Moore has powerful performances in this poignant analysis of indissoluble, yet fragile bonds between parents and children, written and directed by Paul Weitz (About a Boy) . Nick Flynn (Dano) is a young writer in search of definition. His father Jonathan (De Niro), but live according to their own ideas and does not see his son for 18 years. When tidy job at a homeless shelter, Nick finds a purpose in his life and work, until one night Jonathan appears looking for a place to sleep. To give them both a chance for the future, Nick thinks whether to reconcile with his father this "undeniably powerful" (Peter Travers, Rolling Stones) adaptation of the award-winning memoir by Nick Flynn, Another Bullshit Night in Suck City. Best Supporting Actor, The Godfather Part 2 (1974), best actor in "Raging Bull" (1980), best supporting actress "Pleasure without boundaries" (1997); Best Actress "End of the Affair" (1999), best supporting actress "the Hours "(2002), best Actress, Far From heaven (2002)
